summary: This is an automated email notification from a travel authorization system (E2 Solutions) indicating that a travel authorization (ID 10892303) for a trip to Santa Monica, CA, from December 15-17, 2019, has been approved and is awaiting further approval. The purpose of the trip is listed as 'R20 - . . v. pstem - itnessInterview (California)', which appears to be a garbled or redacted reference to a witness interview related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Travel for Witness Interview
events.description: A trip is authorized for travel to Santa Monica, CA, with the purpose listed as a witness interview (with redacted/garbled details).

keyFacts: A travel authorization (ID 10892303) for a trip to Santa Monica, CA, from December 15-17, 2019, was approved and pending further approval as of December 13, 2019.

The purpose of the trip is cryptically listed as 'R20 - . . v. pstem - itnessInterview (California)', which strongly suggests it was for a witness interview related to the Epstein case, with parts of the description redacted or garbled.
The email originates from a U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) travel system (E2 Solutions), indicating official government travel related to the case.
No specific traveler name is provided in the visible text; it appears to be redacted or omitted.
